result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah X Marzette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case and in case 15CF495.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with MJF (DOB 2/9/99)

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case, as it has already been ordered in case 15CF495.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with MJF (DOB 2/9/99)
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case, as it has already been ordered in case 15CF495.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case and in case 15CF495.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court, in custody.  
Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  Due to the lateness of the hour (near noon) the court is unable to hear this matter.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Defendant was REMANDED pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea date.  Defendant has pending case already calendared for Projected guilty plea, this case scheduled same date.  Case adjourned for Projected guilty plea hearing in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Ronald Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeff Musialowski-Glendale Police Department Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF495 that are attached to the complaint.State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel was not able to appear until after 4:15 p.m., was in another court.  Defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing.  State did have an officer present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING monitoring by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BETTY S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/22/15 @ 1:30pm
